    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        The main menu is initialized and the resourcebundle is set to the local language location. The respective labels are then set according to the proper variables in the respective language properties file. The boolean variable queryAppointmentByMonth is set to true and each tables respective set method is called which populates the table with data from the database.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url -
        resourceBundle -

      • setCustomerTable

        public static void setCustomerTable​(javafx.scene.control.TableView<Customer> CustomerTableView,
                                    javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customer,​java.lang.String> customerNameCol,
                                    javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customer,​java.lang.String> customerAddressCol,
                                    javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customer,​java.lang.String> customerPostalCol,

                                    javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customer,​java.lang.Integer> customerCountryCol)
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method sets the customer table with data returned from the Queries.getAllCustomers() method (see Queries.getAllCustomers()).

      • setAppointmentTable

        public static void setAppointmentTable​(javafx.scene.control.TableView<Appointment> AppointmentTableView,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.Integer> appointmentIDCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.String> appointmentTitleCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.String> appointmentDescCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.String> appointmentLocationCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.Integer> appointmentContactCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.String> appointmentTypeCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.String> appointmentStartCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.String> appointmentEndCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.Integer> appointmentCustomerIDCol,
                                       javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Appointment,​java.lang.Integer> appointmentUserIDCol,
                                       boolean queryAppointmentByMonth)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method sets the appointment table, however, an if statement is called to check the boolean argument queryAppointmentByMonth. If true, the appointment table is set with appointment data within the month. If false, it means that the user wishes to see appointments by week, which it then sets with data by week.
        Parameters:
        AppointmentTableView -
        appointmentIDCol -
        appointmentTitleCol -
        appointmentDescCol -
        appointmentLocationCol -
        appointmentContactCol -
        appointmentTypeCol -
        appointmentStartCol -
        appointmentEndCol -
        appointmentCustomerIDCol -
        appointmentUserIDCol -
        queryAppointmentByMonth -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • btnRadioViewMonthHandler

        public void btnRadioViewMonthHandler()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is called when the radio button to view appointments by month is clicked. It sets the boolean variable queryAppointmentByMonth to true, sets the radio button to view by month to selected, and the radio button to view by week to not selected. The setAppointmentTable method is then called.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • btnRadioViewWeekHandler

        public void btnRadioViewWeekHandler()
                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method is identical to the btnRadioViewMonthHandler() method, however, it is called when the radio button view by week is clicked. It then does the opposite of the btnRadioViewMonthHandler() method and calls the setAppointmentTable method.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addCustomerHandler

        public void addCustomerHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called when the add button under the customer table is clicked. It loads the add customer screen.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • editCustomerHandler

        public void editCustomerHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called when the edit button under the customer table is clicked. It sets the variable selectedCustomer, which is an instance of the class Customer to the selected item on the table. It then loads the edit customer screen.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteCustomerHandler

        public void deleteCustomerHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called when the delete button under the customer table is clicked. It is sets the selectedCustomer variable to the selected item from the customer table then prompts the user to confirm if they want to delete the specified customer. If the user clicks yes, the method Queries.deleteCustomer is called and the selectedCustomer.getCustomerID() argument is passed in. If the customer is deleted from the database, the setCustomerTable method is called. If not, it will display and alert to the user that an error occurred.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • deleteAppointmentHandler

        public void deleteAppointmentHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called when the delete button under the appointment table is clicked. It is sets the selectedAppointment variable to the selected item from the appointment table then prompts the user to confirm if they want to delete the specified appointment. If the user clicks yes, the method Queries.deleteAppointment is called and the selectedAppointment.getAppointmentID() argument is passed in. If the appointment is deleted from the database, the setAppointmentTable method is called. If not, it will display and alert to the user that an error occurred.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • btnExitHandler

        public void btnExitHandler​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method is called when the user clicks the exit button. The program then closes.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
